  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21328].

Add support for tel: URI as described in RFC 3966. 
This is used by iOS on the iPhone and also seems to be used by Microsoft Office Communicator.
More info about the RFC:
http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3966.txt
Now a "tel:0123456789" will be rendered as a wiki link instead of a URL. This should be changed to the behaviour which is implemented for the mailto: (RFC 2368) URL handling.
When the URI is written like "tel://012345678" it seems to work, but not for all applications.
fields.summary: Add support for tel: URI as described in RFC 3966.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21297].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce

# Create a space called test
# Create a page called test
# Add an attachment to the test page
# Add the same attachment to the test page
#* Here's how it will look in filesystem:
{quote}
jsashi@localhost:~/confluenceData/confluenceData34/attachments/ver003/245/52/1802245/188/171/1671188/1736713$ ls
1
jsashi@localhost:~/confluenceData/confluenceData34/attachments/ver003/245/52/1802245/188/171/1671188/1736713$ ls
1  2
{quote}
1671188 is the pageid and 1736713 is the attachment id
#* Here's how it will look in database:
{quote}
+--------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------------------+---------+---------+---------------------+--------------+---------------------+----------+--------------------------------------------------------+------------+---------+
| ATTACHMENTID | TITLE                                         | CONTENTTYPE              | PAGEID  | CREATOR | CREATIONDATE        | LASTMODIFIER | LASTMODDATE         | FILESIZE | ATTACHMENT_COMMENT                                     | ATTVERSION | PREVVER |
+--------------+-----------------------------------------------+--------------------------+---------+---------+---------------------+--------------+---------------------+----------+--------------------------------------------------------+------------+---------+
|      1736713 | 181.jpg                                       | image/jpeg               | 1671188 | admin   | 2010-11-19 16:52:33 | admin        | 2010-11-19 16:52:33 |   166253 |                                                        |          2 |    NULL | 
|      1736714 | 181.jpg                                       | image/jpeg               | 1671188 | admin   | 2010-11-19 16:51:34 | admin        | 2010-11-19 16:51:34 |   166253 |                                                        |          1 | 1736713 | 
{quote}
* Note: The latest attachment will get the same ATTACHMENTID as the folder in filesystem
# Remove the test space
# Space will get removed without any problem. However, the following will be shown in the log:
{quote}
2010-11-19 16:59:09,301 ERROR [http-8080-5] [pages.persistence.dao.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao] removeDataForAttachment Could not find attachments to remove at '/home/jsashi/confluenceData/confluenceData34/attachments/ver003/245/52/1802245/188/171/1671188/1736714'
 -- space: 1802245 | url: /spaces/doremovespace.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8080/spaces/removespace.action?key=eeeee | action: doremovespace
{quote}

h5. Intended behaviour
It is true that the folder 1736714 does not exist in the filesystem as only the original attachmentid will be used as the folder name and all subsequent versions of the same attachment will be available as 1,2,3, etc within the original folder. However, this ERROR message in the log can be confusing to users whom might think that they have missing attachments.

fields.description:
"The installation experience in the [Confluence setup guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Setup+Guide] is excellent now - it's clean and logical, without too much skipping around. However, it's missing the [database setup guides|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+Guides] in step 5. The setup guides should be cleaned up (made to look professional and checked for quality/accuracy) and integrated into the main path for production installation. Some have children pages for creating a data source in Tomcat, others do not. This should be consistent. These were all made in a haphazard way years ago, even before we had a docs team. The warning at the top of the Oracle guide guide has been there for years - it was the product of an early frustrated developer, I suspect!

   1. The [Any External DB guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+Any+External+Database] should be deprecated; it's from before we had supported platforms.
   2. The parent page Database Setup Guides should be deprecated; all its children should be moved to underneath the main Confluence setup guide."

----

Notes:

* DB setup guides now display in-text in the updated [Confluence Setup Guide page.|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFT+-+Confluence+Setup+Guide]
* Revised the text to standardize phrasing across the sections.
* Softened the Oracle DBA statement at page top. SEE: 
* Included Luisa's recent change to the Database Setup For MySQL page: "Specify/Increase the value for max_allowed_packet {shell> mysqld \--max_allowed_packet=32M}
* I have added procedural panels using the panel macro to the Database setup pages.  These pages contain includes and excerpts (extant), but the panel macro may make this content appear inappropriately in other pages to which it is pulled in as an include.
* The [Configuring an Oracle Datasource in Apache Tomcat|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFT+-+Configuring+an+Oracle+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat] requires page completion and formatting -- it is currently a series of placeholders headings.  I was uncertain about which content to migrate from the main Oracle DB page, if at all.  The text include is therefore styled to make its appearance felt as an obvious include.
* The 'Before You Start' points at the beginning of the Confluence Setup Guide are fairly rudimentary -- if retained, they will require reworking.
* The updated page with all content and formatting changes is at: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFT+-+Confluence+Setup+Guide
* Have checked the online help dependencies -- there are no problems with deleting the [Any External Database|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+Any+External+Database] page.  Agree that the content of this page is redundant and adds to the docs maintenance load.
* The Database Setup Guides page is redundant and should be deleted IF the DB setup guides are migrated to become children of the Database Configuration page.
* The 'configuring a dataset' child pages will need to be migrated to the parent DB Configuration page.  See attached screenshot.

*Background:*
The personal space side panel open functionality currently differs based upon the chosen theme.  The Easy Reader theme has the panel push other content down / does not hover atop.  The Docs Theme and the Global Look and Feel / default theme behavior has the side panel open over / on top of content that cannot be moved, such as images and/or gadgets.  This behavior is disruptive to some users as it requires a choice between the side panel content or the page content.

*Proposed Change:*
Add a toggle to each personal space or globally modifiable by admin to specify whether the panel should hover / block content, regardless of theme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21228].
  {panel}

Some QA usability feedback:

* Take a screenshot of a webpage, approx 1000*1000 pixels
* Upload it to a confluence page
* Use the property panel on the image, and resize it to "Large"
* Save the page

Now when a user views that page, they see the image scaled down to 300*300 pixels. This means that it is too small to read the content. The user is used to clicking on scaled-down images to see them in full-size, and is confused because this does not work in this case.

The problem is that from the point of view of a user viewing the page, they don't care whether the image is "small", "medium" or "large". If the image is too small to see properly, they will want to click it to see in full-size. But Confluence will only expand images that are "small" or "medium"; clicking on a "large" image will do nothing.

Maybe the behaviour should be that if the image displayed is smaller than the full sized image, then it should be expandable.

Or else, just simply make all images expandable, whatever the size.
fields.summary: Editor Properties Panel: When a large image is resized to "large" it actually becomes too small to see, and cannot be expanded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21208].
  {panel}

As far as I understand the documentation and tests are showing the RSS Feed Builder combines labels with the logical OR operator.

I would like to AND the labels when building an RSS feed - either manually or by the RSS feed builder - instead of the present default OR-ing.

Regular Confluence label work (e.g. contentbylabel macro) allows explicit logical operators by adding and/or signs to force or exclude the presence of a label. When working with rss feeds this doesn't seem to work.
 AND-ing means: "...matches all of the labels...". If I adapted the logic to the contentbylabel macro I would write 'labels=+hummingbird,+blackbird' (show me all content about hummingbirds and blackbirds - but not content labelled with only one of 'blackbird' or 'hummingbird').

An analogy to contentbylabel might look something like:
http://my.wiki.org/createrssfeed.action?types=blogpost&...&labelString=%2Bhummingbird,%2Bblackbird&rssType=atom&maxResults...os_authType=basic (URL-encoded + and even - signs)

And what would be even more comfortable is the explicit exclusion of labels: Show me all content that provides (at least) the labels "bear, dog" but not "cat". If I adapted the logic to the contentbylabel macro I would write 'labels=+bird,-hummingbird' (show me all content about birds, but exclude content about hummingbirds.").

As I noted I am looking for the label functionality (use of logical operators) in rss feeds (Feed Builder, generated URLs) I know from the contentbylabel macro e.g..
fields.summary: AND-ing of labels ins RSS feeds

I am preparing a migration from 2.10.3 to 3.4.1

I have noticed that this 2.10.3 folder confluence-home\framework-bundles
is fully replaced by confluence-home\plugins-osgi-cache\framework-bundles in 3.4.1

However the upgrade - even if successful - does not get rid of the old folder.

Extra files or folders are just a source of confusion.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21174].
{panel}
The folder confluence-home\plugins-temp seems to be used by at least the non bundled plugins to extract some libraries they depend on and which are packaged in the corresponding jar in META-INF/lib.
I have compared the content of this folder for a couple of plugins available from the plugin manager search menu or directly from the authors (calendar, cache, linking, multi-excerpt).
My understanding is that this is the standard way to add dependent jars to a confluence plugin, the plugin framework taking care of extracting them to confluence-home\plugins-temp when required.

The issue if that EACH time the server/confluence starts (or the plugin reinstalled I guess), it does it.
As an example on a DEV server I have <<616>> files in this folder corresponding in fact to the same 8 jars, 77 versions of each of them!!!
This server is not restarted everyday and this is a good thing or we would have 10, 20 or 30 times more files.

You need to do something.
This folder can be part of a backup and this is no good to waste disk space for nothing.

I simply suggest when confluence starts to clear the content of the folder.

 

Note: There is also a related bug for this situation that's been logged at CONFSERVER-52749
fields.summary: When confluence starts, empty the content of the plugins-temp folder

This is an improvement request to allow specifying which user to be used in trusted connection with JIRA.

Proposed example next to the documented examples in [Jira Issues Macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro]
bq. *Anonymous=false*: EITHER use the user credentials defined by the
Administrator OR if they're not present then use the user's credentials

In short allow Confluence to use a specific username to communicate with JIRA regardless of the credentials of the user viewing the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21119].
  {panel}

On the _Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling_ page you can choose the type of Log4j logging to use: either Production or Diagnostic.  However, there's no way to know which type is currently in use.  If you have previously chosen the Diagnostic mode, which our docs warn can degrade performance, you have no way to know whether this mode is currently being used.

*Steps to Repro:*
# On a fresh instance, where you have yet to edit logging settings, go to _Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling_.
# Since this is the first time you've seen this page you can assume that the default logging option, Production, is being used. Click the Diagnostic button.
# The page will reload. Look at the Log4j logging options.

*Expected:*
The Diagnostic button will be disabled, since it is in use and therefore clicking it is fruitless, or some other intuitive UX technique will be used to show that a binary flip is set in some way.

*Actual:*
Both buttons are enabled and clickable and nothing shows which option is currently in use.
fields.summary: display current logging level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21072].
  {panel}

h5. Why rearrange?
\\
Based on the following documentation, the order of the column in indexing is important:

- [Database Column order|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Index_(database)#Column_order]

The upgrade task should also rearrange database indexes which is important to improve the performance of database, please have a look at the following screenshots.

*Upgraded instance*

!conf_3.3.3_upgrade.png!

*Fresh install*

!conf_3.3.3_fresh.png!

h5. Why remove?
{quote}
Another disadvantage is using too many indexes can actually slow your database down
{quote}

Also, quoted above from the following link:

- [Introduction to Database Indexes|http://www.interspire.com/content/2006/02/15/introduction-to-database-indexes/]

Upgrade task also should remove indexes that is not required anymore.

Currently an upgraded Confluence instance, still retains the orders of indexes and also some indexes that are not in use anymore. For example, when we upgrade Confluence 2.8.3 to Confluence 3.3.3, the index {{cl_spacekey_idx}} is still remain in the upgraded instance, but not in fresh install.

Regards,
HengHwa
fields.summary: Upgrade task should rearrange database indexes and remove indexes that is not in use anymore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-21048].
  {panel}

Logging in flat files is great for standard configurations.

However, when deploying Confluence in large organizations, it's annoying to have a lot of log files to monitor, rotate and backup. Especially when you already have some standard log management processes.

We centralize all logs using the syslog protocol. But in order to send Confluence logs to a syslog server, you currently have to modify a lot of files.
And I let Confluence developpers imagine the mess admins have to deal with when upgrading Confluence... Especially when the logging configuration is updated between releases.

So, when will the admins get a convenient logging feature?
fields.summary: Easier syslog integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20998].
  {panel}

The Breadcrumb path does not reflect that path taken to access the page, but rather a single path taken from the space. This causes confusion because clicking on the parent in the breadcrumb path does not take the user back to the parent page, but rather the parent page from which the page is located. The back button and breadcrumb path should be in sync such that clicking the parent link in the breadcrumb is the same as hitting the back button. The current implementation breaks that rule. A single page can have many references, so always displaying the main physical link from the space in which the page is located breaks link from the context.

Example:

Space A/Page A1
Space B/Page B1

If Page B1 links to Page A1 I would expect my breadcrumb to look like this: Dashboard > Space B > Page B1 > Page A1 
Instead my Breadcrumb becomes this: Dashboard > Space A > Page A1

Clicking Space A does not take me to Page B1, but the back button does.
fields.summary: Path breadcrumb navigation - Show user's navigation path to the page instead of the page hierarchy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20959].
  {panel}

We use dozens of thumbnail graphs to display design data, such as line graphs.
The new way that thumbnails are displayed (Confluence 3.3 vs 2.10) is slower and less flexible than the old way.

The only problem with the old way was that the expanded view window did not get raised each time, so it might get buried.
Aside from that, it was much better, especially when reviewing a page with several thumbnails. The old method allowed animation of the content (one frame per mouse click). This was a good way to compare two similar images.

The 3.3 method requires two clicks to go from one image to the next, and the intervening shrink and grow animations totally defeat the animation and visual comparison of content.

1) Please provide an option to disable the animation of thumbnails. These are slow and distracting from the content on a local network and agonizing on a slow link.
2) Please provide a way to reposition and resize the expanded view. This should be remembered for the next expanded view use.
This allows quicker picking through multiple thumbnails.
3) Best: go back to the old way, just raise the window each time a new thumbnail is loaded.

I understand that the new method was a response to complaints about popup blockers preventing the old method. We don't see that, though Firefox blocks popups by default. We think think the solution is worse than the problem. Much worse.

*Note*
Disabling the "fancybox web resources" module would workaround this problem, but causes other parts of Confluence to break, such as the Insert Image dialog.
fields.summary: Improve thumbnail display for users who preferred the old functionality which did not 'animate' the popup
Allow exclusion or limitation of recently updated content to certain users only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20955].
  {panel}

We need to extract blog entries to a remote site by spaceKey and label, then display the output with the blog title summary and the published date.

There are several modules that are close, but are just missing a piece of the puzzle.

getBlogEntries can search by spaceKey and returns BlogEntrySummary, which contains the info we need but can't be sorted by label.
getLabelsByDetail can search by spaceKey and label but doesn't contain the publishedDate for the entry which is critical for our sorting process.

A new API, getBlogEntriesByDetail, that extracts spaceKey and label and returns BlogEntrySummary would be perfect.
fields.summary: Remote API - Additional getBlog API to search for spaceKey and label
Support @self spaceKey within livesearch macro

h3. Workarounds
This bug is caused by pages/viewpageattachments.action, when clicking the upload button to upload files. You can work around this issue by dragging and dropping in various areas:
# Drag and drop on the page in view mode
# Drag and drop on the page in edit mode
# Drag and drop on the attachments page
# Drag and drop on the file upload dialog
fields.summary: Large Attachments (more than 2GB) Cannot be Uploaded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20892].
  {panel}

Over the past couple of releases we have introduced some new bundled plugins that live inside Confluence rather than in a separate project. i.e.:
* Keyboard Shortcuts
* Dashboard macros
* TinyMce
* Advanced macros (to come)

It would be useful for us to make these sub-modules of the confluence-bundled-plugins module. Not only would it clean up the root directory of the confluence project but would allow us to better share code across plugins.
fields.summary: Move bundled plugins under a single module

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20890].
  {panel}

Cmd + Left Arrow should move the cursor to the beginning of the line instead of triggering the browser back button.

This is a Mac Specific KB shortcut. Note that CMD+Right Arrow works as expected by moving the cursor to the end of the line.

h3. Atlassian status

This is a long-standing Firefox bug, tracked here: [https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=289384]. It was planned to be fixed in Firefox 4.0, but was dropped from the release at the last minute. We don't yet have a workaround for it.
fields.summary: Cmd + Left Arrow should go to the start of the line in the editor on Firefox/Mac

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20862].
  {panel}

I added the Confluence bookmarklet to my browser, but was disappointed to find that when I click on it, it does not pre-populate the URL, title or comment fields.

I expected the bookmarklet to work like the the 'Add to DZone' bookmarklet, which autopopulates as follows:

URL:  URL of the page being viewed
Title:  Title of the page being viewed
Description:  Selected text on the page being viewed.

This improvement would make the bookmarklet feature much more user-friendly and time-saving.
fields.summary: Confluence Bookmarklet doesn't work as expected
Request to include the BlackBerry Webkit browser when Confluence formats pages for mobile browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20855].
  {panel}

From a recent support request, the error received was:

|| Type   || Description   || Exception   || Level   || Time ||
| bootstrap  | Could not load bootstrap from environment \\
\\
No server id found.  | org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'bootstrapPluginManager' defined in class path resource [setupContext.xml]: Cannot resolve reference to bean 'bootstrapBundledPluginLoader' while setting constructor argument with key [1]; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'bootstrapBundledPluginLoader': FactoryBean threw exception on object creation; nested exception is java.lang.NullPointerException | fatal  | 2010-09-16 02:31:15 |

I assumed this was due to a corrupt/incomplete confluence.cfg.xml file, however it was actually due to setting the confluence-init.properties to point to a path that didn't exist on the server.

Can we perhaps include more info in the error, or implement more checks to narrow down the potential causes?
fields.summary: More descriptive error if Confluence cannot find Home Directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-20848].
  {panel}

This was discovered when I tried to modify Atlassian Renderer to [adopt AUI|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AUI/AJS.messages].

At the moment the {{.error}} class in {{master.css}} is using a pink-ish red colour (#fcc) for error messages.

This needs to be made transparent as it's creating a conflict when trying to use AUI - as can be seen from this screenshot: [^screenshot.jpg]. The Error icon has a darker pink colour as a result.

It's not that easy to change however as there are at least 35 usages of this class (found when searching for {{class="error"}} in IDEA). But it's a necessary evil to maintain uniformity across our product.
fields.summary: Style all error messages to be the same, where applicable
